meanings.definition: Juliennes (noun): Long, thin strips of vegetables or other food items.
meanings.sent1: I added some juliennes of carrots to the salad for extra crunch.
meanings.sent2: The chef skillfully prepared the dish with juliennes of bell peppers.
meanings.sent3: The juliennes of zucchini were so thin, they looked like delicate ribbons.
meanings.sent4: Her knife danced through the vegetables, creating perfect juliennes.
meanings.sent5: The colorful juliennes made the plate look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: Juliennes (verb): To cut food into long, thin strips.
meanings.sent1: She carefully juliennes the cucumbers for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for juliennes of chicken breast for the pasta dish.
meanings.sent3: He juliennes the potatoes with such precision, it was almost hypnotic to watch.
meanings.sent4: The chef's hands moved swiftly as he juliennes the onions for the soup.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen was filled with the sound of chopping as she juliennes the vegetables.
